dcterms:creator: R. Heckel
M. Simchowitz
K. Ramchandran
M. Wainwright
dcterms:description: The Preference Ranking Problem (PRP) involves ranking items based on pairwise comparisons, aiming to maximize the sum of preferences represented in a preference matrix.
dcterms:title: Preference Ranking Problem (PRP)

dcterms:creator: D. L. Applegate
R. E. Bixby
V. Chvatal
W. J. Cook
dcterms:description: The Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP) consists of finding the shortest possible route that visits each city exactly once and returns to the origin city.
dcterms:title: Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP)

dcterms:creator: K. Andreev
H. RÃ¤ck
dcterms:description: The Graph Partitioning Problem (GPP) involves dividing a graph into two or more parts while minimizing the edge cut between the parts.
dcterms:title: Graph Partitioning Problem (GPP)

dcterms:creator: J. Ceberio
A. Mendiburu
J. A. Lozano
dcterms:description: The Linear Ordering Problem (LOP) is a combinatorial optimization problem that seeks to find a linear ordering of a set of items that minimizes a given cost function.
dcterms:title: Linear Ordering Problem (LOP)

dcterms:creator: G. Reinelt
dcterms:description: The XLOLIB Benchmark is a collection of instances for the Linear Ordering Problem, providing a standard set of test cases for evaluating algorithms.
dcterms:title: XLOLIB Benchmark
